content:
I am a Sophomore Undergraduate at Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur majoring in Computer Science and Engineering, broadly interested in the areas of Probabilistic Machine Learning and Deep Learning.
My sophomore year research work has been centered around using Tensors for Approximate Inference on multi-way and temporal data. Under the supervision of Prof. Ketan Rajawat, I developed a Tensor based model using Markov Chain Time Series for solving the problem of Traffic Estimation and Prediction.
The following Spring Semester(Jan20-Apr20) I have registered for EE609A(Convex Optimization in Signal Processing and Communications),CS771(Introduction to Machine Learning) and MTH535(An Introduction to Bayesian Analysis) and am very excited to explore and study these topics.
I will be working with Prof.Soumendu Sundar Mukherjee the following month(December19) at Indian Statistical Institute, Kolkata.
Last summer I explored Probabilistic Machine Learning. I studied the preliminaries of Bayesian Inference, Non-Conjugacy and Conditional Conjugacy, Linear Models and Exponential Families, Latent Variable Models, EM and VI Algorithms, and Markov Chain Monte Carlo. I worked on Recommender Systems using Bayesian Matrix Factorisation and Poisson Matrix Factorisation. I also explored Variational Autoencoders.
In my Freshmen Year, I was fascinated by Deep Learning. After learning the basics of Deep Learning, I spent quite some time exploring Generative Adversarial Networks.
I’ve had some exposure to Natural Language Processing, though I’m much less acquainted with the subject that I’d like to be. I hope to explore NLP rigorously in the future.
summary:
I am a Sophomore Undergraduate at Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur majoring in Computer Science and Engineering, broadly interested in the areas of Probabilistic Machine Learning and Deep Learning.
My sophomore year research work has been centered around using Tensors for Approximate Inference on multi-way and temporal data. Under the supervision of Prof. Ketan Rajawat, I developed a Tensor based model using Markov Chain Time Series for solving the problem of Traffic Estimation and Prediction.
title: Avinandan Bose

content: Studied and understood paper on Variational Bayesian Inference for Robust Streaming Tensor Factorization and Completion by Cole Hawkins and Zheng Zhang. Explored avenues of Tensor Algebra, Low-rank Tensor Factorization and Time Series Forecasting. Studied and understood paper on Traffic Estimation via Online Variational Bayesian Subspace Filtering by Ketan Rajawat. Extended the findings in the above two papers by deriving an expression such that Tensor Factorization and Completion follows first order auto regressive model for its temporal component.Currently implementing the proposed model in MATLAB.
summary: Studied and understood paper on Variational Bayesian Inference for Robust Streaming Tensor Factorization and Completion by Cole Hawkins and Zheng Zhang. Explored avenues of Tensor Algebra, Low-rank Tensor Factorization and Time Series Forecasting. Studied and understood paper on Traffic Estimation via Online Variational Bayesian Subspace Filtering by Ketan Rajawat. Extended the findings in the above two papers by deriving an expression such that Tensor Factorization and Completion follows first order auto regressive model for its temporal component.
title: Traffic Prediction using Variational Bayesian Inference for Tensor Factorisation and Completion

content: Studied and understood preliminaries of Bayesian Inference, Non-Conjugacy and Conditional Conjugacy, Linear Models and Exponential Families, Latent Variable Models, Expectation Maximization Algorithm, Variational Inference and Markov Chain Monte Carlo. Implemented model in NumPy for density estimation using Gaussian Mixture Models on MNIST dataset. Built a Recommender System using Bayesian Matrix Factorisation and studied and understood Poisson Matrix Factorisation. Built a Variational Autoencoder model on PyTorch to learn a low dimensional representation for handwritten digits.
summary: Studied and understood preliminaries of Bayesian Inference, Non-Conjugacy and Conditional Conjugacy, Linear Models and Exponential Families, Latent Variable Models, Expectation Maximization Algorithm, Variational Inference and Markov Chain Monte Carlo. Implemented model in NumPy for density estimation using Gaussian Mixture Models on MNIST dataset. Built a Recommender System using Bayesian Matrix Factorisation and studied and understood Poisson Matrix Factorisation. Built a Variational Autoencoder model on PyTorch to learn a low dimensional representation for handwritten digits.
title: Probabilistic Machine Learning on GMMs,VAEs and Recommender Systems

content: Implemented Deep Residual Nets for Image Recognition using skip connections between layers and studied the improvement in results without skip connections. Learned the basics of Autoencoders and Generative Adversarial Networks, ideas of Distribution Matching, Minimax Games and Divergence Minimization via Adversarial Learning. Implemented models such as Minimax GAN, LSGAN, Wasserstein GAN. Used evaluation metrics such as Inception Score and Frechet Inception Distance in PyTorch and TorchGAN.
summary: Implemented Deep Residual Nets for Image Recognition using skip connections between layers and studied the improvement in results without skip connections. Learned the basics of Autoencoders and Generative Adversarial Networks, ideas of Distribution Matching, Minimax Games and Divergence Minimization via Adversarial Learning. Implemented models such as Minimax GAN, LSGAN, Wasserstein GAN. Used evaluation metrics such as Inception Score and Frechet Inception Distance in PyTorch and TorchGAN.
title: A Study in GANs

content: A summer project under Programming Club IITK where I studied,understood and implemented alorithms on graphs such as BFS,DFS,Djikstra,Kruskal. In the field of Game Theory such as Game of Nim and Grundy numbers. And miscellaneaous topics such as KMP,Huffman Coding and Disjoint Set Union.
summary: A summer project under Programming Club IITK where I studied,understood and implemented alorithms on graphs such as BFS,DFS,Djikstra,Kruskal. In the field of Game Theory such as Game of Nim and Grundy numbers. And miscellaneaous topics such as KMP,Huffman Coding and Disjoint Set Union.
title: Algorithms in Depth

content: Developed a web app for efficient inventory management across various departments of the NGO Vitraag Vigyaan by facilitating transfers and managing purchase tenders.
summary: Developed a web app for efficient inventory management across various departments of the NGO Vitraag Vigyaan by facilitating transfers and managing purchase tenders.
title: Smart Purchase App
